title: Is life possible on a planet that is part of a system that lacks stars? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anything is possible, but I highly doubt life can exist at -273C with no way of creating or obtaining light energy. It is also theorized that UV rays sparked the creation of the first macromolecules and those are created naturally by stars alone. The chances are about as good as zero with no stars around.
I dunno, but I have to wonder what those planets use for light and heat to generate any form of life.
